title: Live footage of RiotRepertoir openly admitting a serious problem in the game
body:
and proceeding to do absolutely nothing about it for almost 3 months now!

https://imgur.com/a/qVUSY

its like hey guys you know THAT REALLY SERIOUS PROBLEM PLAGUING OUR GAME RIGHT NOW?
...
....
.....
......
That game breaking problem that is capable of invalidating certain roles while making certain other roles appear overpowered?
...
....
.....
......
You know that problem where shields can stack up from like 10 different sources, alot of which are passive and dont even require any player action or involvement but also alot of other sources which are actives, have no cd, are point and click, and can _**instantly**_ shield a champion for over 1k combined shields?
...
....
.....
......
Guys you know that mechanic in our game that lacks any form of counterplay at all but also requires extremely minimal levels of effort to enable?
...
....
.....
......
You know, that problem which was promised a solution in 8.6, even earlier I believe, and here we are at 8.9 pbe?
...
...
...
...
...
...
...
...
RiotRepertoir: .....
Meddler: .....

Lets nerf mages tho!

The game needs a lot of things. Better exploration around shielding, the champions that utilize shields, and the items that empower shields could get us a lot of gains. We unfortunately didn't come to a good solution that was of appropriate scope to get into the game before midseason, at which point it didn't make sense to try to also squeeze that into midseason efforts.

I understand why that explanation will be unpopular. I also would have preferred we came to a proper solution.

What about the potential item solution for anti shielding. One for AP champs and one for AD champs. Or it can be on the 2 grievous wounds items for lowering healing by 40% and dealing increased 40% damage against shields. The existing healers take no new hits, the shielders become less oppressive though. The 2 champs that would realistically HAVE to be addressed after that is sona and taric since they have both on their kits basic abilities, and I know sona especially is in need of help at this time.
Isnt that the whole point about shields? They hardly get any penalties like healing and kinda more effective short term but they are temporary?
Quite a few champs have shields on such low cooldowns that they can maintain them permanently with others having an 80% uptime which is still pretty dam high. They need penalties now frankly.

Almost every player above diamond fucking 4 has come up with the solution, so why can't you?

Nerf shields. Not "add anti-shield effects" unless you want to repeat the mistake (that you all refuse to fix) with heal reduction.

and if for some reason you guys can't figure it out, hire me for the price $10,000 a year (that's cheap for a Rioter, right?) and I will watch high tier play and actually discuss with people (not just tell them my plans, an actual conversation) about how to better the game. Then you take the changes I give you, let me test them with some people (for game breakingness, it would be hard to gauge precise balance over that small sample), and then put it into the patch.

Games are more fun when they're more balanced. Games are more competitive when they're balanced. I have no clue why you haven't figured this out. I have no clue why balance doesn't follow this fundamental game design.

> I understand why that explanation will be unpopular. I also would have preferred we came to a proper solution.

Conqueror wasn't a proper solution to the tank issue top lane. It's just a bandaid fix to let bruisers duel tanks. People still take Grasp in matchups that aren't against tanks because it wins lane and scales better. Conqueror is shit in a teamfight too, so bruisers **still** cannot teamfight.

Isn't wanting a "proper solution" yet releasing Conqueror as an anti-tank bandaid completely contradictory?

> Almost every player above diamond fucking 4 has come up with the solution, so why can't you?

Coming up with *a solution* is not the same as *coming up with a good solution*. Also literally **none** of those players can actually playtest these ideas unless Riot invites them in to do so.

I haven't tested it myself, but I hear building conquerer on Wukong can apply the extra damage to his ult. IMO a cyclone with true damage, with its already pretty good damage, is an alright teamfighting tool.
except you have to be in combat for 4 seconds AND THEN auto attack to activate conqueror

When I was seeing (and saying) the "10% less damage across the board" memes earlier this season I thought to myself: "what if shields were an exception to that and damage was increased versus them instead?  LIke what if armor/MR was half as effective towards shields?"

Just remove heal and shield power and make enchanters build AP again. The heals and shields weren't a problem until Riot added items that give enchanters tank stats while also making their heals and shields better than if they built straight up AP unless they built straight up AP(even ignoring support item) and also managed to afford a Rabadons and even then there's no telling if it's a better shield or not.

Heal and shield power is the problem. First off, they increase healing and shielding while also giving bruiser stats to enchanters, making them harder to kill. Second, they also amplify their own actives/passives, so each one makes the other items you build stronger. Make supports build items for their actives, instead of having them build everything that just makes itself better by building the next item.

Many champions depend on their own inate shields in order to survive. Adding an item to help destroy shields to kill the adc would be a good idea, however wouldn't that be bad on champions that have their own shields like Shen, Poppy or Diana to name a few?

If this happens, wouldn't we end up in a healing meta after that, with Soraka, and Nami healing the adc which then would probably be considered broken at that point and therefore would warrant buffs to anti healing items and favouring laners with inate sustain rather than shielding.

My point is to tread carefully please :)
